original_title: Sri Lanka bonds quoted wide ahead of DDR, dollar Rs307/308.50
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s government bonds were inactive Monday morning as the market awaited an announcement on domestic debt restructuring later in the week, dealers said while the spot US dollar was quoted at 307/308.50 rupees.
Bond markets were quiet without active firm quotes, shortly after opening, dealers said. A Treasury bill auction is to be held on Tuesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted wide at 23.25/24.00 percent in mid-morning trade up from 23.15/30 Friday.
A bond maturing on 01.07.20225 was quoted wide at 27.00/28.00 percent down from 27.20/40 percent Friday.

Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers are expected to consider a domestic debt restructuring plan which will also go through the parliament’s committee on public finance before being debated, Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe has said.
Sri Lanka gave a bank holiday on June 30, giving a total of 5 days of holidays.
The Colombo Stock Exchange has also declared Friday a holiday. (Colombo/June26/2023 Update II)
